This most interesting surname is a patronymic form of Huggin, which itself is a diminutive from the Old French personal name Hugh, which was introduced into England by the Normans after the Conquest of 1066. The surname is first recorded in the early 14th Century (see below), while other early examples include: Amisia Hugines, recorded in the Subsidy Rolls of Worcestershire in 1327; and John Hugyn, mentioned in the Feet of Fines of Staffordshire in 1337.

Biblical Meaning: The name Michael is a Biblical baby name. In Biblical the meaning of the name Michael is: Poor; humble. American Meaning: The name Michael is an American baby name. Meaning & History. From Ioseph, the Latin form of Greek ιωσηφ (Ioseph) , which was from the Hebrew name יוֹסֵף (Yosef) meaning he will add. In the Old Testament, Joseph is the eleventh son of Jacob. Because he was the favourite of his father, his older brothers sent him to Egypt and told their father that he had died
